divs: Sighting DetailsI was out walking my dogs around my apartment complex at 6:50 am. The sun was out, and the sky was a clear light blue. On our way back to the apartment, I noticed something in the southeastern sky, approximately 60 degrees above the horizon. I do not know how far the object was, or its approximate size. It was a dark-colored, diamond-like object. I thought it was a small kite, because it glided around very slowly. I remember thinking, how strange that someone would fly a kite first thing in the morning, but it had no attached string. As it hovered around very slowly, its right half reflected the sun's light. I realized that the object was metal, and that's when I started to get really curious about what I was looking at. I studied it for a little while longer to 1) run though the list of things it could be 2) commit the experience to memory so I could later describe it. I watched it for maybe 3-4 minutes, until it started to fade into the distance towards the southeast. I brought my dogs in before it completely disappeared and promptly went onto our porch (which faces due south) but saw nothing. I do not know what it was, except that: 1) it was not a bird, for there were no wings. 2) it was not an airplane; no airplane i know of can hover at such low speeds. 3) it was not a hand-glider. there were no visible people hanging from, or riding the object. 4) i know helicopters can hover, but this object had no turning blades. 5) it had no lights, and it wasn't zipping around at high speeds like UFOs in sci-fi movies. 6) I do not know much about weather balloons, but I thought weather ballons traveled up. 7) there was not enough wind speed to carry a metallic object without a motor into the sky.
